brief_summary.textblock:
Pelvic lymph node dissection (PLND) is the most accurate staging tool to determine lymph
      node involvement in prostate and bladder cancer. The main complication of PLND is
      development of a lymphocele, which can cause symptoms including lower abdominal pain, leg or
      penile/scrotal edema, bladder outlet obstruction, deep venous thrombosis or
      infection/sepsis. The incidence of radiographic (asymptomatic) and symptomatic lymphoceles
      following PLND varies between 12,6-63% and 1,6-33% respectively. Medicated sponges such as
      Tachosil® are indicated in surgery for improvement of haemostasis and to promote tissue
      sealing. They could reduce lymphocele development by increased tissue sealing, due to a
      mechanical effect of the sponge itself and a lymphostatic effect of the included thrombin
      and fibrinogen. Our goal is to prospectively assess the lymphostatic effect of Tachosil(r)
      in patients undergoing transperitoneal PLND with or without radical prostatectomy or PLND
      with bladder cancer surgery.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of TachoSil® on Incidence of Symptomatic and Radiographic Lymphoceles After Extended Pelvic Lymph Node Dissection in Prostate and Bladder Cancer.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  Age > 18 years old

          -  Diagnosis of prostate cancer or bladder cancer on pathology

          -  Undergoing transperitoneal pelvic lymph node dissection.

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  Previous pelvic surgery or irradiation.

          -  Any type of clotting disorder.

intervention.intervention_name: 1 TachoSil hemostatic sponge (9,5 cm x 4,8 cm) placed on each side on the external iliac artery.

clinical_study.official_title: Effect of TachoSil® on Incidence of Symptomatic and Radiographic Lymphoceles After Extended Pelvic Lymph Node Dissection in Prostate and Bladder Cancer.

primary_outcome.measure: development of a radiographic lymphocele on abdominal ultrasonography

primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily during standard postoperative care until removal of the catheter, with an expected average of 1 day.

primary_outcome.measure: volume produced by postoperative drainage catheter (lymphorrhea)
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily during standard postoperative care until removal of the drain, with an expected average of 1 day.

primary_outcome.measure: time between operation and first flatus, first peristalsis, first passing of stool and removal of gastrostomy tube (signs of ileus recuperation).
primary_outcome.time_frame: Daily during standard postoperative care up to date of first flatus, first peristalsis, first passing of stool and removal of gastrostomy tube (signs of ileus recuperation), with an expected average of 1 day.

primary_outcome.measure: development of a radiographic lymphocele on abdominal ultrasonography

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.measure: decrease in serum hemoglobin on the first postoperative day

secondary_outcome.description: Total cost includes: surgical procedure, hospitalization and possible complications up to the first month post-surgery.
